intro: Melanoselinum seguieri, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, large, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery-gray pubescence. Its flowers emit a strong, sweet fragrance at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Melanoselinum seguieri is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and nocturnal blooming habit.
